content.text: In the Netherlands, when ordering water at a restaurant, bottled water is usually served rather than tap water.

content.title: Using 'mag ik...'
content.explanation: The expression 'mag ik...' means 'may I have...?'. It's a polite way to ask for something.

content.title: Order at the restaurant!
content.setting: You are at a restaurant in Amsterdam. The LLM will act as the waiter.
content.user_goal: Politely order bread and water using the phrases you have learned.
content.llm_persona: Act as a friendly Dutch waiter. Respond in Dutch in a simple and natural way. Your goal is to help the user practice. If the user has difficulties, subtly guide them to use the expression 'Mag ik...'. Keep your responses short.
content.initial_prompt: Goedenavond! Wat kan ik voor u doen?
content.success_condition: The user has correctly ordered water and bread using the structure 'Mag ik...'.

content.text: In Dutch, 'oo' is pronounced as a long 'o', similar to 'oo' in 'boot'.
